title: Why did Ashoka leave Kalinga? - Quora

response.answer_text: Ashoka wanted to spread out his territory to open opportunities for free trade by establishing uniform currency which had limitless advantages for a kingdom extending from persia to Thailand. Acquiring Kalinga would have made this dream of Ashoka a reality. So he did it. Over a hundred thousand soldiers lost lives fighting the battle which was intended to bring peace and prosperity. The pile of dead soldiers and curses from their widows might have shattered the heart of the great ruler. His ambition and intention were not on the same line which he realised. Hence he started his transformation from a conquer to a human. Dropping his flag from the fort of Kalinga was his way of saying “I have lost”
